column2: in mandátîs ejus volet nìmis. ^ Blessed is the man that feareth the Lord
column3: in his commandments  he shall delight exceedingly.

column1: 2 ^ Potens in terra èrit semen ejus~
column2: generátio rectórum benedicétur. ^ His seed shall be mighty upon earth
column3: the generation of the righteous shall be blessed.

column1: 3 ^ Glória et divìtiaĕ in domu ejus, et justìtia ejus manet in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ Glory and wealth shall be in his house, and his justice remaineth for ever and ever.
4 ^ Exórtum èst in tènebrîs lumen rectîs~
column2: misèricors, et miserátor, et justus. ^ To the righteous a light is risen up in darkness
column3: he is merciful, and compassionate, and just.

column1: 5 ^ Jucùndus hòmo qŭi miserétur et còmmodat~
column2: dispónet sermónes suos in judìcio, ^ Acceptable is the man that showeth mercy and lendeth
column3: he shall order his words with judgment,

column1: 6 ^ qŭia in aĕtèrnum non commovébitur. ^ because he shall not be moved for ever.

column3: parátum cor ejus speráre in Dòmino. ^ The just shall be in everlasting remembrance~
column4: he shall not fear an evil tiding~
column5: his heart is ready to hope in the Lord.

column2: non commovébitur donec despìciat inimícos suos. ^ His heart is strengthened~
column3: he shall not be moved until he look over his enemies.
justìtia ejus manet in sáĕculum sáĕculi~
column4: cornu ejus exaltábitur in glória. ^ He hath dispersed
column5: he hath given to the poor
column6: his justice remaineth for ever and ever
column7: his horn shall be exalted in glory.

column3: desidèrium peccatórum períbit. ^ The wicked shall see, and shall be angry, he shall gnash with his teeth and pine away
column4: the desire of the wicked shall perish.
